type.description: Transformer to add custom SDL to the schema

sdl.description: GraphQL SDL and apply to the schema

name.description: Handler for Swagger / OpenAPI 2/3 specification. Source could be a local json/swagger file, or a url to it.

headers.description: JSON object representing the Headers to add to the runtime of the API calls

type.description: Transformer to add prefix to the GraphQL types and operations.

prefix.description: The prefix to apply to the schema types. By default it's the API name.

includeOperations.description: Set to true in order to prefix the operations names

type.description: Transformer to apply rename of a GraphQL type

name.description: The name you wish to set to your remote API, this will be used for building the GraphQL context

source.description: A pointer to your API source - could be a local file, remote file or url endpoint

context.description:
Custom JSON object to add to the GraphQL context, use this to inject custom
fields and later use it in your custom resolver. This object will be located
in the context, under an object named as the API

handler.description: A path to a local file, or a node module name, that handles the conversion of the API source specification (Any of: Openapi)

transformations.description: List of transformations to apply to the current API source, before unifying it with the rest of the sources (Any of: Extend, Prefix, Rename)

sources.description: Defines the list of your external data sources for your API mesh

transformations.description: Transformations to apply to the unified mesh schema (Any of: Extend, Prefix, Rename)

additionalResolvers.description: Additional resolvers, or resolvers overrides you wish to add to the schema mesh
